p: A number of epidemics caused by the A. albopictus mosquito have been observed in Europe, including several autochthonous chikungunya outbreaks in France and Italy in 2007, 2010, 2014, 2015 and 2017, and autochthonous dengue outbreaks in France and Croatia in 2010 (Rezza et al. 2007; La Ruche et al. 2010; Gjenero-Margan et al. 2011; Grandadam 2011; Delisle et al. 2015; Venturi et al. 2017). Heavy precipitation may have contributed to the autochthonous chikungunya transmission in France in 2014 by causing an explosive increase in vector abundance (Roiz et al. 2011; ECDC 2015).
